solution_line_template: If she bought a {total_pages} pages book and wrote on {pages_written_week1} pages, the number of empty pages remaining is {total_pages}-{pages_written_week1} = <<{total_pages}-{pages_written_week1}={empty_pages_after_week1}>>{empty_pages_after_week1} pages.
The number of remaining empty pages is {empty_pages_after_week1}-{pages_written_week2} = <<{empty_pages_after_week1}-{pages_written_week2}={empty_pages_after_week2}>>{empty_pages_after_week2} pages.

When she spilled coffee on the remaining empty pages, the number of damaged pages was {percentage_damaged}*{empty_pages_after_week2} = <<{percentage_damaged}*{empty_pages_after_week2}={damaged_pages}>>{damaged_pages}
The number of empty pages remaining that she could write on is {empty_pages_after_week2}-{damaged_pages} = <<{empty_pages_after_week2}-{damaged_pages}={final_empty_pages}>>{final_empty_pages} pages
